I\\nBKETTON\\nMy\ godmother\ lived\ in\ a\ handsome\ house\ in\ the\ clean\ and\\nancient\ town\ of\ Bretton.\ Her\ husband\\\'s\ family\ had\ been\\nresidents\ there\ for\ generations\,\ and\ bore\,\ inmates\\nspecially\ suited\ me.\ The\ large\ peaceful\ rooms\,\ the\ well-\\narranged\ furniture\,\ the\ clear\ wide\ windows\,\ the\ balcony\\noutside\,\ looking\ down\ on\ a\ fine\ antique\ with\\none\ son\,\ before\ I\ knew\ her\;\ her\ husband\,\ a\ physician\,\ having\\ndied\ while\ she\ was\ yet\ a\ young\ and\ handsome\ woman.\\nShe\ was\ not\ young\,\ as\ I\ remember\ her\,\ but\
